channel.title: Player Rights help (PI)
channel.description:
So basically I wanted the donator "$" next to the donator's name. So I went on to Client Class (client sided) and checked the "case:" for the MODICON aka the Donator image, and the case was 5. So basically that means players need to have their player rights set to "5" in order to get that symbol next to their name, and that actually worked.
The problem is, having player rights set to "5" gives you owner commands, and when I check the commands class I don't find anything that hints to player rights 5 giving owner commands or something. Is there any way to change this so player Rights 5 doesn't give you any special commands but regular player commands?

This is the commands class in the packets folder

Read full topic

item.title: Player Rights help (PI)
item.dc:creator: @Kingen50cent Kingen50cent
item.description:
@Kingen50cent wrote:

So basically I wanted the donator “$” next to the donator’s name. So I went on to Client Class (client sided) and checked the “case:” for the MODICON aka the Donator image, and the case was 5. So basically that means players need to have their player rights set to “5” in order to get that symbol next to their name, and that actually worked.

The problem is, having player rights set to “5” gives you owner commands, and when I check the commands class I don’t find anything that hints to player rights 5 giving owner commands or something. Is there any way to change this so player Rights 5 doesn’t give you any special commands but regular player commands?

Read full topic
